title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish man Seamus Culleton has been in ICE detention for five months after overstaying his visa in 2009.
Culleton, married to a U.S. citizen, described poor conditions at the ERO East Montana ICE Detention Camp in Texas.
Culleton missed a green card interview due to detention; his bail was rescinded despite lack of removal notice.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs, New England Patriots wide receiver, recorded over 1,000 receiving yards in the 2025 season.
Diggs could be cut to save up to $20.8 million in cap space despite a three-year deal signed in March 2025.
Diggs faces legal issues including assault charges, with a court date set, and a lawsuit claiming reputational damage.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard police and fire departments rescued a dog named Rufus from icy Mill Pond on Tuesday night.
The rescue operation, involving a drone and quick firefighter response, lasted less than ten minutes.
Rufus returned home without serious injuries, and a video of the rescue was shared by the fire department.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues caused delays on all 12 commuter rail lines, with some trains delayed up to 50 minutes.
Over 25 commuter rail trains were canceled on Wednesday due to signal issues, according to MBTA.
Blue Line service was replaced by shuttles between Orient Heights and Wonderland due to a power problem.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj, former Worcester councilor, found guilty of assaulting a police officer during an ICE arrest incident.
Haxhiaj was sentenced to six months probation and 40 hours of community service following the misdemeanor conviction.
She was acquitted of interfering with an officer; her lawyer criticized ICE's conduct during the chaotic arrest.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue's BlueHouse BOS lounge at Logan Airport, opening this summer, will be located near gate C23 in Terminal C.
The lounge will offer complimentary food and beverages, a full-service bar, and private workspaces with free WiFi.
Spanning 11,000 square feet, the lounge is 40% larger than its JFK counterpart and will feature unique Boston-themed amenities.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN's Field Yates predicts Patriots will draft Utah's offensive tackle Caleb Lomu with the 31st pick in 2026.
Caleb Lomu, a 6-foot-6, 304-pounder, was a standout at Utah, not allowing a single sack in 2025.
Despite strong postseason struggles, Patriots plan to keep Will Campbell at left tackle, says coach Mike Vrabel.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin, recently acquired by the Red Sox, models his game after former MVP Dustin Pedroia.
Standing 5-foot-7, Durbin is known for his strong defense and low strikeout rate at the plate.
Durbin joined the Red Sox in a six-player trade with the Brewers and hopes to increase his power at Fenway Park.

title: Jaylen Brown offers Drake Maye advice on how to ‘level up’ after  championship heartbreak
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown shared advice with Patriots' Drake Maye on coping with championship loss, urging him to use the experience as fuel.
Brown, reflecting on his own NBA Finals losses, emphasized the importance of resilience and turning heartbreak into motivation.
Brown expressed confidence in Maye's future, encouraging him to have a strong comeback and focus on self-belief and improvement.

title: Mass. spa owner, manager arrested on prostitution charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Westborough Wellness Spa owner Michael Langille and manager Leir Guo were arrested on charges related to prostitution.
Investigation began after a man died of cardiac arrest at the spa in December 2024, discovered nude.
Spa lacked permits for massages; police found evidence of sexual services advertised online, leading to a search warrant.
